211.name: Text2
211.charsReplaced:
Press the reset button. This is a very simple temperature converter using sliders to interpolate between 0 and 100 degrees for Fahrenheit and Celsius.

The sliders are constrained to stay within their bounds, so you cannot drag the Celsius to more than ~37C, because that would exceed 100F.

This does not use edit constraints, but demonstrates cooperating solvers. Cassowary does the calculation, and DeltaBlue updates the strings that display the current slider value.

221.storedString:
Z3-based engine implementation. It's very slow, because each step is an HTTP request to start Z3 on the server, solve the system, and return new values. Each request takes about 50ms on my machine, right next to the lively-kernel server. It can only get worse. Oh, and it is stateful, so if somebody else is playing with this, it will interfere.

You can try adding and removing rectangles. Anything that is a lively.morphic.Box will be constrained to act as a piston, and the morph called "Crank" will be constrained to be the center.

The

223.storedString: constraints are all on the owner

226.storedString:
. The pistons only have a reset script to set their origin to the center (because that makes the constraints easier)

Be patient when clicking "reset", especially if you have a slow connection to lively-kernel.org. It's not optimized and does a request to the server for each constraint, instead of collecting them first. The solving itself is very fast, so the difference between having many pistons or just one isn't too bad, the problem is the communication with the server.

To modify the step size, change the increase to "crank.t" in

231.storedString: . To modify the distance of the crank to the center, modify the constraint on its "r"
